notesStmt.note: Stains and tidemarks from damp, especially on first and last few leaves. Slight rodent damage at bottom corner in part. Ink blurred in parts. Foredge of paper ends rolling. Small tears. Lacuna after folio 132.

Duke of Sussex plate with his coat of arms, pasted on the inner front cover.A note of acquisition of the manuscript in French, dated 1774, folio 2v.An English desciption of the manuscript, in pencil, folio 1v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A collection of mystical, kabbalistic and magical texts.

msItem.title: Perush sefer yetsirah פרוש ספר יצירה
Perush sefer yetsirah (fragment) פרוש ספר יצירה (קטע)
Perush sefer yetsirah פירוש ספר יצירה
Perush sefer yetsirah (liḳutim) פרוש ספר יצירה (לקוטים)
Perush sefer yetsirah פרוש ספר יצירה
Perush ketuvim (Shir ha-shirim) פרוש כתובים (שיר השירים)
Ma᾿amar al yiḥud ha-Shem מאמר על יחוד השם
Alfa beta de-Metatron אלפא ביתא דמטטרון
Seder pe῾ulat ha-yetsirah סדר פעולת היצירה
Ḳovets be-ḳabalah ma῾asit קבץ בקבלה מעשית
Sod ets ha-da῾at סוד עץ הדעת
Keter shem ṭov כתר שם טוב
Ḳovets be-ḳabalah ma῾asit קבץ בקבלה מעשית

supportDesc.foliation: Irregular Hebrew foliation (92-159), 91 leaves might be missing at the beginning and 8 leaves missing after folio 66.

collation.p: Quires of 8 leaves each, marked with a vertical catchword at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of the 14th century. Mosheh: his name marked off frequently in the text, e.g., folio 8v, 14v, etc.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Kabbalistic Tracts. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 15,299.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum at the Duke of Sussex's sale, lot 466, on 03 August 1844: inscribed, folio 153v.
